intro: Hieracium rhogaleum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has hairy, rough-textured leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium rhogaleum is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in sunny conditions.
